sources.full: Sarguro's Compendium of Odds and Ends

feat.name: Devious
entries: Your cunning and agility give you an edge in combat. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency with {@item thieves' tools|PHB} and one skill of your choice. If you are already proficient with {@item thieves' tools|PHB}, your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make with it.

You learn thieves' cant, a secret language that is described in the rogue's {@classFeature Thieves' Cant|Rogue|PHB|1} feature. If you already know thieves' cant, you learn to speak, read, and write two other languages of your choice.
If you have successfully hidden from a creature, your weapon attacks deal an additional {@dice 1d6} damage to it.

feat.name: Enraged
entries: You've learned how to utilize the strength of your fury, though you cannot fully control it. You gain the following benefits:

items: If you have the {@classFeature Unarmored Defense|Barbarian|PHB|1} feature, you gain a +1 bonus to AC while you aren't wearing armor. Otherwise, while you aren't wearing armor, your AC is equal to 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Constitution modifier.

If you already have the {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian|PHB|1} feature, you gain one more use of it. Otherwise, you learn to enter a rage as per the barbarian class feature, though your Rage Damage remains at +2 and does not increase. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Infusion Initiate
entries: Your inventiveness has granted you the ability to imbue mundane items with magic.

You learn three {@filter infusion options|optionalfeatures|Feature Type=AI} of your choice from the artificer class. If the infusion has a prerequisite of ayn kind, you can choose that infusion only if you're an artificer who meets the prerequisite.
If you already have the {@classFeature Infuse Item|Artificer|TCE|2} feature, your maximum number of infused items increases by 2; otherwise, you may only have two infused items at a time.

Whenever you reach a level that grants the Ability Score Improvement feature, you can replace one of these infusions with another one from the artificer class. The infused magic vanishes from an item if you give up your knowledge of that infusion for another one.

feat.name: Inspirational
entries: You've had some training in performance, allowing you to inspire others with your musical prowess. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency with one {@item musical instrument|PHB} of your choice, and you can use that instrument as a spellcasting focus for any spell you cast that uses Charisma as its spellcasting ability.
Whiel you are playing an instrument you are proficient with, you can cast the {@spell guidance} cantrip, and you can target a creature within 30 feet of you that can hear you.

feat.name: Ki Initiate
entries: You've gained a more worldly knowledge, bringing you a new understanding of both your mind and body. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your walking speed increases by 10 feet while you are not wearing armor or using a shield.

You learn to use the following ki abilities from the monk class: {@classFeature Flurry of Blows|Monk|PHB|2}, {@classFeature Patient Defense|Monk|PHB|2}, {@classFeature Step of the Wind|Monk|PHB|2}, and {@classFeature Quickened Healing|Monk|PHB|4|TCE}. If an ability refers to a Martial Arts die and you don't have the {@classFeature Ki|Monk|PHB|2} feature, the die is a {@dice d4}.
You gain 2 ki points to spend on ki features (these points are added to any ki points you might have from another source). You regain all expended ki points whenever you finish a short or long rest.

feat.name: Light Armor Master
entries: You learn to maneuver more effectively, even while wearing light armor. You gain the following benefits:

items: While you are wearing light armor and not wielding a shield, you gain a +1 bonus to AC.
While you aren't wearing medium or heavy armor, your walking speed increases by 5 feet.

feat.name: Nimble Tumbler
entries: You have trained your body to be more nimble and spry, granting you the following benefits:

items: While you are {@condition prone}, standing up uses only 5 feet of your movement.
You are resistant to fall damage while you aren't {@condition incapacitated}.

You may attempt to tumble through the space of a hostile creature without using extra movement or incurring opportunity attakcs. To do so, you must make a Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check. The DC is equal to 10 or 5 + the hostile creature's Challenge Rating, whichever is higher. If you fail, you must stop moving before entering the creature's space, and your speed becomes 0 until the end of your turn. You cannot end your turn in a hostile creature's space.

feat.name: Pious
entries: You learn to channel divine energy. If you don't already have a {@item holy symbol|PHB}, you gain one that represents a god or pantheon of your choice. As an action, you can hold up your {@item holy symbol|PHB} to do one of the following:

items: You entreat your deity to heal your allies. Choose one creature you can see within 60 feet of you. That creature regains a number of hit points equal to {@dice 1d4} + your proficiency bonus.

You speak a prayer censuring the undead, invoking the effect of the cleric's {@classFeature Channel Divinity: Turn Undead|Cleric|PHB|2} feature. The save DC for this effect is equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier.

entries: You can use either of these abilities a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Shapeshifter
entries: You learn to attune yourself to the natural world, allowing you to change your form into that of a beast. When you gain this feat, choose {@filter a beast that has a challenge rating of 1/4 or lower that doesn't have a flying or swimming speed|bestiary|Challenge Rating=[&0;&1/4]|type=beast|miscellaneous=!reprinted;!swarm|speed type=!fly;!swim}. If you have the {@classFeature Wild Shape|Druid|PHB|2} feature, you may choose a new beast each time you transform using this feat.

You can use your action to magically transform into that creature for 1 hour. Otherwise, your transformation follows the criteria and limitations of the druid's {@classFeature Wild Shape|Druid|PHB|2} feature.
You can use this ability a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a short or logn rest.

feat.name: Tracker
entries: You've learned how to roam freely, as well as how to sleuth out the creature's that occupy it. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain a climbing speed or a swimming speed equal to your walking speed (your choice).
You learn one cantrip of your choice from the {@filter druid spell list|spells|level=0|class=Druid}. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for this spell.
You gain proficiency with the {@skill Survival} skill.
You have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) checks to forage for food and fresh water.

feat.name: Zealous
entries: You've learned to channel divine energy to heal your allies or harm your enemies. You gain the following benefits:

items: As an action, you can touch a creature and restore a number of hit points to it equal to {@dice 1d4} + your proficiency bonus.
Whenever you make a successful melee weapon attack against a creature, you can choose to deal an additional {@dice d8} radiant damage to the target.

entries: You can use either of these abilities a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Acclimated
entries: More accustomed to life above ground, your tender eyes have overcome their sensitivities. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency with one of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Insight}, {@skill Investigation}, or {@skill Perception}.
You ignore the effects of your Sunlight Sensitivity trait.

feat.name: Alu'Tel'Quessir Training
entries: You have received advanced training that heightens your senses and quickens your reflexes, reserved for only the most elite Alu'Tel'Quessir warriors. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your walking speed increases by 5 feet.
You gain {@sense blindsight} out to 5 feet. While you are submerged in water, your {@sense blindsight} increases to 30 feet.

feat.name: Blessing of the Pale Lady
entries: Your people have been granted power by the moon, and through deep meditation you have unlocked even greater lunar boons. You gain the following benefits.

items: You no longer need to sleep and can't be forced to sleep by any means. To gain the benefits of a long rest, you can spend all 8 hours doing light activity, such as praying to the moon or keeping watch.

At sunset, you may gain a number of temporary hit points equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Wisdom modifier (minimum 1 hit point). If the moon is full, you roll a {@dice d10} instead. You lose any remaining temporary hit points when the sun rises.

feat.name: Budding Chief
entries: You have the makings of a great chief, and your allies revere your strength and leadership. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency with one of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Deception}, {@skill Intimidation}, or {@skill Persuasion}.

As a bonus action, you can allow a creature who can see or hear you to maneuver itself into a more advantageous position. That creature can use its reaction to move up to half its movement speed without provoking opportunity attacks. The creature can't maneuver itself using this feat again until it finishes a short or long rest.

feat.name: Bugbear's Rest
entries: Your ability to nap and rest is unrivaled. None would challenge your sleeping prowess. You gain the following benefits:

items: If you sleep for 10 or more hours as part of a long rest, you regain all of your Hit Dice, regardless of how many you have expended.

If you have taken at least one short or long rest within the last 8 hours, you have advantage on Constitution saving throws made to avoid gaining a level of {@condition Exhaustion}, and magic can't put you to sleep.

feat.name: Celestial Legacy
entries: Your divine blood has granted you great power and awareness. You gain the following benefits:

items: You can cast the {@spell detect evil and good} spell at will, without expending a spell slot. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell.
You can use your Radiant Soul or Radiant Consumption trait as a bonus action instead of an action, and you regain the use of that ability whenever you finish a short or long rest.

feat.name: Centurion Training
entries: You have received the leadership training that other members of your race covet. You are always prepared, able to respond quickly and lead confidently. You gain the following benefits:

items: You may add half your proficiency bonus to your initiative rolls (rounded down).
You gain proficiency with medium armor and shields.
When you use your Saving Face trait, you do not expend a use of it unless your roll succeeds.

feat.name: Cindersoul
entries: You have uncovered the aggressive magics of elemental fire inside yourself, granting you the following benefits:

items: When a creature within 5 feet of you hits you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to deal {@dice 1d4} fire damage to the creature.

Once you reach 5th level, you can cast {@spell flame blade} as a 3rd-level spell, requiring no spell slot or components, and you must finish a long rest before you can cast it this way again. You can also cast this spell using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

feat.name: Deep Sense
entries: Your people have a natural knack for finding and appraising highly-valued items, typically ones that are magical in nature. You gain the following benefits:

items: You have a +5 bonus to your passive Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) score.

You learn to cast the {@spell detect magic} and {@spell identify} spells, but only as rituals. You can also cast these spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

feat.name: Eladrin Magic
entries: YOu can channel the influence of the Feywild to your body, manifesting in unique magical abilities depending on your current season. You gain the following benefits:

items: You learn to speak, read, and write Sylvan.

You learn the cantrip and 1st-level spell from the Eladrin Magic table below that corresponds to your current season. You can cast the 1st-level spell once, requiring no spell slot or components, and you must finish a long rest before you can cast it this way again. You can also cast this spell using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

feat.name: Draconblood Decorum
entries: You're able to better utilize your sense of smell, giving you improved impressions of other creatures. Using this information, you know exactly how to manipulate both your allies and your enemies. You gain the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) checks against creatures you can smell within 15 feet of you.

You learn the {@spell friends} or {@spell vicious mockery} cantrip. If you choose {@spell friends}, you do not require a material component to cast it. Your spellcasting ability for the chosen spell is the ability increased by this feat.

feat.name: Eagle Eye
entries: Your eyesight is as keen as your distant, avian kin. You gain the following benefits:

items: Attacking at long range doesn't impose disadvantage on your ranged attack rolls.
You can see up to 1 mile away with no difficulty, able to discern even fine details as though looking at something no more than 100 feet away from you.

feat.name: Fallen Legacy
entries: Your corrupted nature has granted you great power and sight. You gain the following benefits:

items: You can cast the {@spell false life} spell at will, without expending a spell slot.
You can use your Necrotic Shroud trait as a bonus action instead of an action, and you regain the use of that ability whenever you finish a short or long rest.

feat.name: Ever-Expanding Mind
entries: Your ability to present logical arguments is unsurpassed, and your brain continues to grow over time. You gain the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on Intelligence ({@skill Persuasion}) checks, assuming your character can make a logical argument for the check.

You learn to speak, read, and write a number of additional languages equal to your proficiency bonus. Each time your proficiency bonus increases, you learn to speak, read, and write an additional language. At your DM's discretion, each time you would learn a language with this feat, you may instead gain proficiency with one tool of your choice.

feat.name: Grand Breed
entries: Your legs grow stronger from hard training and extended use. You gain the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put you to sleep.
When you take the {@action Dash} action on your turn, creature's can't make opportunity attacks against you for the rest of your turn.
The damage die for your hooves increases to a {@dice d6}, and your hooves count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

feat.name: Grung Tied
entries: Through a combination of herbal tonics and ritual magic, your grung physiology evolves, and you are considered one caste level higher amongst other grungs. You gain the following benefits:

items: You ignore the effects of your Water Dependency trait. Instead, you count as one size larger when determining how much water you must consume in a day.

As an action, you can make a chirring noise to which other grungs are immune. Each creature within 10 feet of you that can hear you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw. The DC for this saving throw equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier. On a failed save, a creature is {@condition stunned} until the end of your next turn. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Guardian
entries: Your body developed a seemingly spontaneous mutation, likely brought upon your body's genetic alterations. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain an additional Animal Enhancement of your choice. Alternatively, you may instead choose one of the following spells: {@spell barkskin}, {@spell protection from poison}, {@spell speak with animals}, or {@spell spider climb}. You may cast the chosen spell on yourself at will, without expending a spell slot or material components. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

feat.name: Hardened Shell
entries: Your shell is not just used for protection, but as a weapon as well. You gain the following benefits:

items: If you move at least 10 feet in a straight line on your turn, you can use your bonus action to immediately enter your shell. You slide on the ground for a number of feet equal to the remainder of your movement. Any creature in your path must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier). On a failed save, a creature takes bludgeoning damage and falls {@condition prone}. The bludgeoning damage is equal to a number of {@dice d6}s equal to your proficiency bonus. If you hit one or more creatures on your turn, you stop moving at the end of your turn. Otherwise, you continue moving until you emerge from your shell or the ground brings you to a stop. Once you hit at least one creature using this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

feat.name: Iconoclast
entries: Your people may not deny that the gods exist, but most deny their altruism. You have trained as an iconoclast, learning to hunt down the corrupt servants of these equally corrupt deities. You gain the following benefits:

items: You have resistance to radiant damage.

When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Wisdom saving throw to take only half damage, you can use your reaction to instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

feat.name: Illusory Master
entries: Your experience with illusory magic has granted you greater understanding of its art. You gain the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on saving throws against illusions.
When you hit a creature with an attack on your turn, that creature can't turn {@condition invisible} until the start of your next turn.
You can cast {@spell disguise self} using your Firbolg Magic trait at will, without expending a spell slot.

feat.name: Inquisitive Empathy
entries: Naturally curious, you have honed your telepathic powers to sense how other creatures are feeling at a given moment. You can probe deeper into a creature's mind, but only rarely. You gain the following benefits:

items: You can cast {@spell detect thoughts} spell at will, without expending a spell slot or material components. Once you probe deeper into a creature's mind using this spell, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest. When you cast {@spell detect thoughts} with this feat, you cannot detect the presence of creatures you can't see. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

feat.name: Kenku Know-How
entries: Your desire to fly pushes you to elevate yourself and your allies, albeit in different ways. You gain the following benefits:

items: You can take the {@action Help} action as a bonus action.

When you take the {@action Help} action to assist a creature with an ability check that uses a skill or tool check you are proficient with, the creature may add your Intelligence modifier to the check (minimum +1).

feat.name: Labyrinthine Mind
entries: Your body and mind have adapted to darkness, and you are capable of discovering hidden paths, though you risk the madness of Baphomet in doing so. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain {@sense darkvision} out to 60 feet.
You can perfectly recalled any path you have traveled.

When you reach 5th level, you can use your action to attempt to discover the shortest route to a location by rolling a percentile dice. If you roll a number equal to or lower than your level, you immediately cast the {@spell find the path} spell without expending a spell slot or material components. If you fail to cast this spell, you suffer from an effect from the {@table short-term madness|DMG} table for 1 minute, using the number you rolled on the percentile dice to determine the effect, and you can't use this ability again until you finish a long rest. If you successful cast this spell, you can't use this ability again for {@dice 1d6} days.

feat.name: Lighthearted
entries: Few things can shake your mood, and your respites are particularly restful. You gain the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

If you spend one ore more Hit Dice to regain hit points during a short rest, you regain an additional {@dice 1d6} hit points for each Hit Die you spend. If you consume alcohol during your rest, you roll an additional {@dice 1d8} hit points (instead of a {@dice d6}).

feat.name: Locathah Hunter
entries: You have become accustomed to hunting on land, even with weapons others consider crude, and you've learned to survive far from your aquatic home. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency with the {@item spear|PHB} and {@item trident|PHB}, if you don't already have it.

While you are wielding a {@item spear|PHB} or {@item trident|PHB}, its damage increases to {@dice 1d8} (or {@dice 1d10}, if you wield it in two hands), and if you score a critical hit with either weapon, you can roll the damage die an additional time and add it to the extra damage of the critical hit.
You ignore the requirement to be submerged in water from your Limited Amphibiousness trait. Instead, you count as one size larger when determining how much water you must consume in a day.

feat.name: Loxodon Stampede
entries: You've learned to use your sizable body to ignore enemies that block your path. You gain the following benefits:

items: When you take the {@action Dash} action, you can choose to pass through the space of one or more Large or smaller creatures. Each creature must succeed on a Strength saving throw (DC 8 + your Strength bonus + your proficiency bonus) or be knocked {@condition prone} and take bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice 1d10} + your Strength modifier. Whether a creature succeeds or fails its saving throw, it cannot make opportunity attacks against you for the rest of your turn. Once you use this ability, you can't ust it again until you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Lurker
entries: Your natural stealthiness and affinity for ambush become even more apparent. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency with the {@item poisoner's kit|PHB}.
When you apply poison to a weapon, you may add your proficiency bonus to the poison damage you deal on a hit.
You have advantage on {@skill Stealth} checks while you are in swampy, forested, or underwater environments.

feat.name: Master of Waves
entries: You have made the ocean your ally, bending the frigid sea to your will. You gain the following benefits:

items: You learn the {@spell ray of frost} cantrip. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

When you take damage from a creature you can see, you can use your reaction to cast the {@spell armor of Agathys} spell without expending a spell slot or material components, and you regain the ability to cast it this way when you finish a long rest. You can also cast this spell using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level (but not as a reaction). Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

feat.name: Mind Thrust
entries: Your quori spirit teaches you the different ways to assault—and protect—the minds of others. You gain the following benefits:

items: When you use your Mind Link trait to grant a creature the ability to speak telepathically with you, it has resistance to psychic damage for the duration.

You can cast the {@spell mind spike|XGE} spell without expending a spell slot, and you must finish a long rest before you can cast it this way again. You can also cast this spell using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

feat.name: Moonspeaker
entries: Your connection to the sacred moon has blessed you with great power. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain a climbing speed or a swimming speed equal to your walking speed (your choice).
Choose one other subrace of shifter besides your own. While you are shifted, you gain the benefits of that subrace's Shifting Feature trait in addition to your own.

feat.name: Mountain Mover
entries: Your strength and reslience rivals the giants that roam your homeland. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain a climbing speed equal to your walking speed.

As an action, you can pick up a large boulder or rip a chunk of natural stone out of the ground and make the attack with it. The boulder is a simple melee weapon with the thrown property. It has a normal range of 20 feet and a long range of 60 feet, and on a hit, it deals bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice 2d6} + your Strength modifier. A creature struck by this boulder must make a Strength saving throw (DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier) or be knocked {@condition prone}. You can use this ability a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Night Glider
entries: Your people are quite familiar with mounts, mainly dinosaurs. You gain the following benefits:

items: The range of your Silent Speech trait increases to 90 feet.

You can cast the {@spell animal friendship} spell at a range of 90 feet. You can cast this spell once without expending a spell slot, and you must finish a long rest before you can do so again. Additionally, you can cast this spell using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

You can use your Silent Speech to speak telepathically with a beast {@condition charmed} by you, or your mount if you have one. The beast or mount will understand you even if you don't share a language, but you have no special ability to understand it in return.

feat.name: Nilbog Trickery
entries: You learn the mischievous ways of your spirit-possessed kin, able to taunt and fool your enemies with ease. You gain the following benefits:

items: You learn the {@spell vicious mockery} cantrip. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

When a creature you can see targets you with an attack or a harmful spell, you can use your reaction to force the creature to first make a Wisdom saving throw. The DC for this saving throw is equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier. On a failed save, the creature must choose a new target or lose the attack or spell. This ability doesn't protect you from area effects, such as the explosion of a {@spell fireball}. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Psychic Invasion
entries: You have learned to not only sense a creature's thoughts, but also how to infest it's brain with false realities. You gain the following benefits:

items: You learn the {@spell minor illusion} cantrip. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

You can cast the {@spell phantasmal force} spell, requiring no spell slot or material components, and you must finish a long rest before you can cast it this way again. You can also cast this spell using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

feat.name: Ravenite Resilience
entries: Through intense focus or a traumatic event, you have unlocked a hidden power deep within yourself. You gain the following benefits:

items: When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell dragon's breath|XGE} spell, requiring no spell slot or material component, and you must finish a long rest before you can cast it this way again. You can also cast this spell using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for this spell.
Whenever you cast {@spell dragon's breath|XGE}, you gain resistance to the chosen damage type when you cast the spell. This resistance lasts for 1 hour.

feat.name: Scaleborn
entries: Whether as a blessing granted to you at birth or some dormant part of your heritage, you have the magic of dragon's blood within you. You gain the following benefits:

items: You learn two cantrips from the {@filter Sorcerer spell list|spells|level=0|class=Sorcerer}. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.
Choose one damage type: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison. You gain resistance to the chosen damage type.

feat.name: Shadow Dancer
entries: You learn an ancient fighting style of your people, attacking your enemies from all angles with a flurry of spiked chains. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency with the {@item spiked chain|SCOE} if you don't already have it.
A spike chain has the finesse property when you wield it.
When you gain this feat, a small rift opens from the Shadowfell, laying a single {@item spiked chain|SCOE} at your feet.

feat.name: Snake in the Grass
entries: You have honed the innate abilities of your kin, able to assume the form of any snake you have seen. You gain the following benefits:

items: You can cast the {@spell suggestion} spell, requiring no spell slot or components, and you must finish a long rest before you can cast it this way again. Your spellcasting ability for the spell is the ability increased by this feat. If you have spell slots of 2nd level or higher, you can cast this spell with them.

YOu can use your action to magically transform into a {@creature Giant Poisonous Snake|MM}. The transformation follows the criteria and limitations of the druid's {@classFeature Wild Shape|Druid|PHB|2} feature, though it only lasts for up to 1 hour. When you transform, you may choose the appearance of the snake, though not so much that its size changes. Once you use this ability, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Speech of the Lotus
entries: You have spent your waking hours in the comfort of nature, learning the calm, soothing ways of nature's prose. You gain the following benefits:

items: You learn to speak, read, and write Sylvan and two additional languages of your choice.

When you reach 5th level, you can cast the {@spell speak with plants} spell, without expending a spell slot, and you must finish a long rest before you can cast it this way again. You can also cast this spell using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

feat.name: Tabaxi Curiosity
entries: Your desire for knowledge often lands you in dire situations, though you gain statisfaction from even near-death experiences. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency with one of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Arcana}, {@skill History}, {@skill Insight}, {@skill Investigation}, {@skill Nature}, or {@skill Religion}.

You have advantage on death saving throws, and whenever you make a death saving throw, your mind enters a tranquil space between life and death. There, you find yourself alone with a deity appropriate to your people, and you may ask it a single question that can be answered with "yes", "no", or "unknown". The deity answers to the best of its knowledge.

feat.name: Terrasoul
entries: You have discovered the obstinate magics of elemental earth inside yourself, granting you the following benefits:

items: You have {@sense tremorsense|MM} with a range of 30 feet. Within that range, you can detect and pinpoint the origin of vibrations, provided you and the source of the vibrations are in contact with the same ground or substance. Your {@sense tremorsense|MM} can't be used to detect flying or incorporeal creatures.

Once you reach 5th level, you can cast the {@spell erupting earth|XGE} spell, requiring no spell slot or components, and you must finish a long rest before you can cast it this way again. You can also cast this spell using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

feat.name: Tidesoul
entries: You have unlocked the unfathomable magics of elemental water inside yourself, granting you the following benefits:

items: You can move into a hostile creature's space regardless of its size, and you can move through a space as narrow as 1 foot wide without squeezing.

Once you reach 5th level, you can cast the {@spell tidal wave|XGE}, requiring no spell slot or components, and you must finish a long rest before you can cast it this way again. You can also cast this spell using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

feat.name: True Mimicry
entries: You have learned to mimic the inherent traits of other creatures, further improving your ruse. After you use your Shapechanger trait to imitate a humanoid, you can spend 10 minutes improving your transformation, further altering your anatomy. During this time, you must remain within 60 feet of a creature of the race you are mimicking.

When the transformation is complete, you gain the benefits of one of the mimicked creature's racial traits of your chioce. You cannot mimic the creature's Ability Score Increase or Age traits. If the mimicked trait requires you to select an optoin (such as the {@race Elf (High)|PHB|High Elf}'s Cantrip trait), you must select the same option as the mimicked creature. If the trait has level requirements, you must fulfill the level requirements to gain that benefit.
You benefit from the mimicked racial trait until you use your Shapechanger trait again, you mimic another trait using this feat, or until you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Upgrade
entries: Your frame has been updated to fulfill a particular function, improving your operating efficiency for a given subset of tasks. You gain the following benefits:

items: Choose one of the following upgrades:

items.name: Envoy
items.entry: You gain proficiency with one tool of your choice. Additionally, choose one tool you're proficient with. This tool is integrated into your body, and you double your proficiency bonus for any ability checks you make with it. You must have at least one free hand to use this integrated tool.

items.name: Juggernaught
items.entry: You may double your Strength bonus when you make a Strength-based attack roll, a Strength check, or a Strength saving throw (minimum bonus of +2). Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest. Additionally, youc ount as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

items.name: Skirmisher
items.entry: Your walking speed increases by 5 feet. Additionally, you can take the {@action Disengage} action as a bonus action on your turn. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you move 0 feet on one of your turns.

feat.name: Windsoul
entries: You have freed the liberating magics of elemental air inside yourself, granting you the following benefits:

items: You can cast the {@spell feather fall} spell on yourself at will, without expending a spell slot.

Once you reach 5th level, you can cast the {@spell fly} spell, requiring no spell slot or components, and you must finish a long rest before you can cast it this way again. You can also cast this spell using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

item.name: Spiked Chain
entries: These are wicked and exotic weapons that hail from the Shadowfell. They are made up of large metal chains whose last few links on each end are enlarged and riddled with spikes.

entries.name: Special
entries: When you hit a creature with a spiked chain on your turn, you can use a bonus action to attempt to grapple the target. Until the grapple ends, the target takes {@dice 2d4} piercing damage at the start of each of its turns and you can't grapple another target.

optionalfeature.name: Juggernaut
entries: Vanguards who adopt the juggernaut technique are able to protect their allies with a large, nearly impenetrable tower shield.

entries.name: Defense
entries: This shield grants +3 to your AC instead of +2.

entries.name: Offense
entries: As an action while you are holding your oversized shield, you can bash a creature with it. Make a melee attack roll against a creature within 5 feet of you. On a hit, your attack deals bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice 1d8} + your Strength modiifer. The number of damage dice you roll for this action increases when you reach certain levels in this class: {@dice 2d8} at 5th level, {@dice 4d8} at 11th level, and {@dice 6d8} at 20th level.

entries.name: Utility
entries: As an action, you can plant your tower shield in the ground. While it is planted, your shield is large enough to provide three-quarters cover for one creautre of your size, or half cover for two creatures one size smaller than you are. You can also pick up your planted shield as an action.

optionalfeature.name: Sentinel
entries: Armed with a perfectly round shield, the sentinel technique allows you to protect your allies at range.

entries.name: Defense
entries: This shield grants +2 to your AC.

entries.name: Offense
entries: Your shield is considered a martial melee weapon with the finesse and thrown properties. It has a normal range of 20 feet and a long range of 60 feet, and on a hit, the shield deals bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Strength modifier. When you gain the Extra Attack feature and you attack a creature by throwing your shield, you can make another ranged attack roll against a second target you can see within 20 feet of the first. You may continue to attack targets using your airborne shield until you have no more attacks remaining. If you are within 20 feet of your shield after your last thrown attack, it returns to your hand at the end of your turn, provided it can reach you unimpeded.

entries.name: Utility
entries: When you use the {@optfeature Interception|TCE} or {@optfeature Protection|PHB} fighting style, you can throw your shield as part of the same reaction. If you do so, you can protect a creature within 20 feet of you that you can see. After you do so, your shield returns to your hand at the start of your next turn, provided it can reach you unimpeded.

optionalfeature.name: Twin-Guard
entries: Favoring speed and mobility over stopping power, a vanguard who adopts the twin-guard technique wields two pointed bucklers attached to each of their forearms.

entries.name: Defense
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to your AC for each buckler you are wearing (maximum +2).

entries.name: Offense
entries: Each of your attached bucklers is considered a martial melee weapon with the finesse and light properties. On a hit, a buckler deals piercing damage equal to {@dice 1d4} + your Strength modifier. At 7th level, the damage die of your bucklers increases to {@dice 1d6}.

entries.name: Utility
entries: For each arm that is wielding a buckler and nothing else, you gain the following benefits:

items: Your walking speed increass by 5 feet (maximum of +10 feet).
Your hand is considered free for the purposes of manipulating objects or ammunition on your turn.

subclass.name: Way of the Five Forms
subclassFeatures: Way of the Five Forms|Monk|PHB|Five Forms|SCOE|3

subclass.name: Way of the Great Oak
subclassFeatures: Way of the Great Oak|Monk|PHB|Great Oak|SCOE|3

subclass.name: Oath of the Open Sea
subclassFeatures: Oath of the Open Sea|Paladin|PHB|Open Sea|SCOE|3

subclassFeature.name: Aeronaut
entries: Artificers who dream of flying into the folds of the Weave typically become Aeronauts. Using their magical contraptions to fuel their fight, Aeronauts who survive their field of study go on to become deadly forces to be reckoned with on the battlefield. Aviation is the newest field of study for artificery and as such did not see much use in battle until the end of the last war. However should the fighting ever start again, Aeronauts will be ready to fill the skies and prove their worth against the other artificer traditions.

For years people have gazed upon the firmament with wonder. The path to mastering the skies is not concrete and the creativity of many inventors has given birth to flying machines of all shapes and sizes. As an Aeronaut you decide what has inspired the design of your flying contraption. At your option, you can pick from or roll on the Aviator's Inspiration table to determine what inspired your character.

entries.caption: Aviator's Inspiration
rows: {@b Great Beasts.} You have studied the dragon, the {@creature griffon|MM}, and the {@creature roc|MM}. Your designs consist of massive indestructable wings that command dominion over the skies.

{@b Elemental Air.} You took to researching the elemental plane of air studying tempests and mephites alike. Your designs hold you aloft with an intricate system of rings and runes which conjure powerful gales to power your flight.

{@b Extra Planar.} Your research is more alien. Taking inspiration from the Gith and former {@creature mind flayer|MM|Illithid} empires has lead you to design truly unique forms of transportation such as a board which hovers using psychic energy.

{@b Infernal Influence.} Your research or dealings with fiends has procured some designs of infernal nature. Like their war machines you are kept in the skies by an engine that spites a torrent of flame in your wake.

{@b Ancient History.} Your study of old cultures has lead you to adapt their old ways and reinvent them in your image. Kite like contraptions made of canvass and resin are what you've designed to keep you airborne.
{@b Original Design.} A flash of genius or years of dedicated hard work has lead you to design a type of aircraft that is unlike any other the world has ever seen before.

subclassFeature.name: Tool Proficiency
entries: When you adopt this specialization at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with air vehicles and one set of {@item artisan's tools|PHB} of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Flying Contraption
entries: At 3rd level, you've completed the prototype of your first flying machine, and you can magically activate it as an action. You determine the machine's appearance, what happens when it activates, and how you operate it; your choice has no effect on its game mechanics.

Once activated, your flying machine can remain in the air for a number of hours equal to your proficiency bonus, after which it deactivates. This duration ends early if you are knocked {@condition unconscious} or if you choose to end it as a bonus action. If you are aloft when the duration expires, you descend at a rate of 30 feet per round until you land.
Once you activate this machine, you can't activate it again until you finish a short or long rest, unless you expend a spell slot of 1st-level or higher to activate it again.
While your machine is active, you gain the following benefits:

items: You have a flying speed of 20 feet, and you can hover. This speed increases when you reach certain levels in this class: 30 feet at 5th level, and 50 feet at 15th level.
You can use your flying machine as a spellcasting focus for your artificer spells.
If you make a melee attack against a creature on your turn, that creature can't make opportunity attacks against you for the rest of your turn.

As an action, you can propel yourself forward in a rush of wind. Each creature within 5 feet of you must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC or be knocked {@condition prone}. You can then immediately fly up to half of your flying speed (rounded up). At 9th level, the range of this ability increases to 10 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Momentum
entries: Starting at 5th level, you've learned how to manipulate the air around you, even using it as a weapon. When you make an attack roll against a creature on your turn, you deal additional thunder damage to the target equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum +1).

subclassFeature.name: Death from Above
entries: By 9th level, you learn to take advantage of your altitude, preferring to strike creatures from above. If you fly at least 10 feet in a straight line immediately before attacking a creature, you gain a +5 bonus to the attack roll.

subclassFeature.name: Wingman
entries: Also at 9th level, you have created an enhanced model of your flying machine, which has increased handling and speed. You can take the {@action Help} action as a bonus action.

Additionally, the flying speed granted by your Flying Contraption feature increases by 10 feet. You can forgo this increase to allow your flying machine to support an additional creature that is Medium or smaller. That creature treats your flying machine as an independant mount. If this creature is still in your flying machine when it deactivates, it descends at a rate of 30 feet per round until it lands.

subclassFeature.name: Ace Pilot
entries: Beginning at 15th level, your effortless flying has permanently altered your reflexes. You gain proficiency in Dexterity saving throws, and while you are flying, you gain a +1 bonus to your AC.

subclassFeature.name: Archivist
entries: What are the best ways to store vast amounts of information? That question has occupied chroniclers and librarians for centuries. Scrolls and books were the finest information-storing methods for a long time, but the first Archivists imagined something greater: storing information in a real or an artificial mind. What library could match a mental archive capable of accessing information in seconds?

As they work towards this goal, Archivists have become masters of storing knowledge and creating artificial intelligences fueled by magic. These techniques have yet to be perfected and institutionalized, and of all artificers, archivists are on the cutting edge of arcane science.

subclassFeature.name: Tool Proficiency
entries: When you adopt this specialization at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with {@item calligrapher's supplies|PHB}. If you already have this proficiency, you gain proficiency with one other type of {@item artisan's tools|PHB} of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Artificial Mind
entries: At 3rd level, you discover how to awaken a mind inside an object. Whenever you finish a long rest and have your {@item calligrapher's supplies|PHB} on your person, you can touch a Tiny nonmagical object, inscribing arcane runes on its surface. A magical mind is awakened inside the object, granting you the following benefits while it is on your person:

items: You can use the object as a spellcasting focus for your artificer spells.
You can cast the {@spell mind sliver|TCE} cantrip.

You can telepathically communicate with the object, and it supplies you with advice and information on certain topics. Choose one of the skills from the Artificial Mind table below, determined by your Tiny object's primary material. While it is on your person, you may add {@dice 1d4} to the result of any check that uses that skill. You may choose a different skill from the list whenever you finish a short rest. When you reach 9th level, this bonus increases to {@dice 1d8}, and at 15th level, you may choose two skills instead of one.

entries: Your Artificial Mind remains awakened until you finish your next long rest, at which time you need to reinscribe its runes with your {@item calligrapher's supplies|PHB}. You may instead choose to create another Artificial Mind out of a different object.

subclassFeature.name: Psychic Nexus
entries: At 5th level, you've learned how to use your artifices to affect the minds of creatures around you.

entries.name: Mental Network
entries: While you have your Artificial Mind item on your person, you can communicate telepathically with anyone carrying an item bearing one of your artificer infusions. That creature can also telepathically communicate with you, provided you are within 100 miles of one another and on the same plane of existence.

entries.name: Boggle the Mind
entries: When you deal psychic damage to a creature on your turn, you gain a bonus to the damage roll equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1).

subclassFeature.name: Shielded Mind
entries: Starting at 9th level, your mind becomes strong enough to defend against any assault against it. You gain resistance to psychic damage.

Additionally, you can reroll a failed Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma saving throw. If you do so, you must use the new roll. You can use this ability a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses whenever you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Psychic Archive
entries: At 15th level, your Artificial Mind is able to receive and transmit more information than ever before.

entries.name: Infopath
entries: As an action while your Artificial Mind is on your person, you can transform your body into pure, arcane information. You may then teleport to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of an item bearing one of your artificer infusions, where your body physically reappears. You can only teleport to an item that is on the same plane of existence as you are.
Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest, unless you expend a spell slot of 2nd-level or higher to teleport again.

entries.name: Information Overload
entries: When you deal psychic damage to a creature on your turn, you can expend a spell slot of 1st-level or higher to force the creature to make an Intelligence saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Bladeshaper
entries: While some artificers are content firing cantrips from afar, the bladeshaper has developed a dynamic style that allows them to barrage their enemies with a combination of martial prowess and lightning-fast transmutation.

entries.subclassFeature: The Sharpest Tools in the Box|Artificer|TCE|Bladeshaper|SCOE|3

subclassFeature.name: The Sharpest Tools in the Box
entries: Beginning at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with {@filter martial weapons|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=martial weapon} and one type of {@item artisan's tools|PHB} of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Dynamic Weapon
entries: At 3rd level, you gain the ability to create a dynamic weapon—multiple weapons that occupy a single space. You can create a dynamic weapon by performing a special ritual while you are within 5 feet of the weapons you wish to combine. You perform the ritual over the course of 1 hour, which can be done during a short rest, and you can bind a number of weapons together equal to your proficiency bonus. You can't bind an artifact or a sentient weapon, and you must be proficient with each weapon you bind, otherwise the ritual fails. When the ritual ends, each weapon disappears, and your dynamic weapon appears in your hands, tkaing the form of one of hte bound weapons of your choice.

As a bonus action, you can transform your dynamic weapon into one of its other bound forms, a {@item pole (10-foot)|PHB|10-foot pole}, or a 5-foot {@item staff|PHB}. Your dynamic weapon functions identically to a weapon or item of the same type, including any magical bonuses or infusions, with the following benefits:

items: You can use this weapon as a spellcasting focus for your Artificer spells.
This weapon counts as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.
When you attack with your dynamic weapon, you can use your Intelligence modifier, instead of Strength or Dexterity modifier, for the attack and damage rolls.

entries: The bond of your dynamic weapon breaks if you die, if you perform the 1-hour ritual to bind a different set of weapons, or if you use your action to split the weapons apart. When this bond breaks, all of the bound weapons appear at your feet. Lastly, your dynamic weapon reappears in your hands if it is more than 5 feet away from you for 1 minute or more.

subclassFeature.name: Dynamic Attack
entries: Starting at 5th level, you can attack with your dynamic weapon twice, instead of once, whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn. You can use your bonus action to transform your dynamic weapon between these attacks, if you wish.

subclassFeature.name: Defensive Form
entries: By 9th level, you learn to reflexively defend yourself. You may bind a shield to your dynamic weapon during the 1-hour ritual, treating it as a weapon for the purposes of the ritual.

Additionally, as a reaction when you are hit by an attack, you can transform your dynamic weapon into a shield. You gain a +2 bonus to your AC, or a bonus according to your bound shield. You can choose to revert your dynamic weapon to its previous form at the start of your next turn, no action required. You can only benefit from one shield at a time.

subclassFeature.name: Dynamic Infusion
entries: Also at 9th level, you learn how to use your artificer infusions to augment your arsenal. Choose two artificer infusions that can be applied to a simple or martial weapon. When you change your dynamic weapon's form, you may choose one of these infusions to apply to the new form. The benefits of a single infusion do not stack, and a weapon's magical bonus to attack or damage rolls may not exceed +3.
This feature doesn't count against the number of infusions you know, nor does it count against the number of items you can infuse at once.

subclassFeature.name: Adaptive Weapon
entries: At 15th level, you have mastered the stability of your dynamic weapon, allowing it to exhibit properties from multiple forms. When you transform your dynamic weapon, you may pick two of the following traits of any other bound weapon to apply to the weapon's new form.

items: The weapon's damage type.
The weapon's damage die.
Any weapons property, such as light, thrown, or versatile.
Any one magical property, such as a +1 to attack and damage rolls, an ability that expends charges, or a passive feature.

entries: The chosen property must be compatible with your dynamic weapon's new form. For example, if you have bound a {@item longbow|PHB}, a {@item maul|PHB}, and a {@item flame tongue|DMG} (a magical flaming sword) to your dynamic weapon, you may transform your dynamic weapon into a {@item longbow|PHB} that deals fire damage equal to {@dice 2d6} + your Dexterity or Intelligence modifier on a hit.

{@note Magic weapons' abilities and properties can vary widely, and some weapon combinations may be too unrealistic or unbalanced to work with this feature. Be sure to work with your DM as to how these properties might interact with one another, and which ones are feasible.}

subclassFeature.name: Soulkeeper
entries: When a life ends, its energy descends to the lower planes, becoming a shadow of its former thoughts, personality, and form. A highly skilled spellcaster can craft a special device using precious gems to intercept this facsimile of a soul, infusing it within a costly vessel.
These individuals are known as soulkeepers—artificers that combine necromancy and conjuration to form unique gems that fuel their various powers.

subclassFeature.name: Tool Proficiency
entries: When you adopt this specialization at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with {@item jeweler's tools|PHB}. If you already have this proficiency, you gain proficiency with one other type of {@item artisan's tools|PHB} of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Soul Gems
entries: Starting at 3rd level, when a life ends in your presence, you are able to trap the spirit into a precious gem. When a creature you can see dies within 30 feet of you while you are holding an emerald, diamond, ruby, or sapphire that costs at least 50 gp, you can use your reaction to trap the departing soul within it. The dying creature must have an Intelligence score of 4 or higher for its soul to be trapped.

Containing these souls is taxing on both yourself and the vessel; each gem can only hold one soul at a time, and you can only maintain a number of souls gems equal to your proficiency bonus. You can't absorb another soul into a gem while you are at your maximum.
While you have at least one filled soul gem on your person, you gain the following benefits:

items: Your weapon attacks deal an additional +1 damage.
You regain an additional {@dice 1d8} hit points when you are the target of a healing spell.

You can unleash one of the stored souls to cast a conjuration or necromancy spell you have prepared without expending a spell slot. The spell must be 1st level, and the gem no longer houses a soul after you use this ability, though it remains intact.

subclassFeature.name: Spiritual Infusion
entries: At 5th level, your experience with capturing souls has granted you the ability to utilize their contained power. As an action, you can destroy a soul gem to immediately infuse an item with one of your known infusions. If you try to exceed your maximum number of infusions, the oldest infusion immediately ends, and the new infusion applies, as normal.
When you do, choose one of the following effects to imbue on the infused item:

items.name: Defending Spirit
items.entry: While wearing or wielding this item, a creature's AC cannot be reduced below 14.

items.name: Guiding Spirit
items.entry: While wearing or wielding this item, a creature can cast the {@spell guidance} cantrip. It may also cast the {@spell augury} spell, without expending a spell slot or material components. Once cast, {@spell augury} can't be cast again with this item until the next dawn.

items.name: Sentry Spirit
items.entry: While wearing or wielding this item, a creature has advantage on initiative rolls. In addition, the wearer can't be surprised, provided it isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

items.name: Sage Spirit
items.entry: While wearing or wielding this item, when a creature makes an Intelligence check it is not proficient with, the creature may roll {@dice 1d6} and add the result to the check.

subclassFeature.name: Soulguard
entries: At 9th level, your control over death has bolstered your resilience. You have advantage on death saving throws, your maximum hit points can't be reduced, and your soul can't be consumed, taken, trapped, or otherwise restricted unless you allow it.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Gemcraft
entries: Also at 9th level, while you have at least one filled soul gem on your person, you gain the following benefits:

items: The additional weapon damage you deal increases to +2.
When you unleash a soul to cast a spell, you can cast a 2nd level or lower conjuration or necromancy spell you have prepared.

entries: Additionally, the maximum number of items you can infuse at once increases by 2, but those extra items must be infused using your Spiritual Infusion feature.

subclassFeature.name: Ferry the Spirits
entries: By 15th level, your mastery of capturing the departed has granted you new understanding of the space between worlds. Once on your turn, you can teleport to an unoccupied space within a number of feet equal to your remaining movement speed.

Additionally, while you are holding a diamond worth at least 500 gp, you can cast the {@spell soul cage|XGE} spell without expending a spell slot, using the diamont as the material component. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest, and you can only have one soul trapped by this ability at a time.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Bloodrager
entries: Barbarians who dedicate themselves to the Path of the Bloodrager have offered their lifeblood up to an otherworldly being, who in return allows the adventurer to draw upon their magic and chaos to fuel their rage.

Because a patron's power is usually concentrated in a specific type of magic, but not all patrons can grant barbaric boons to those that serve them. The patron of a Bloodrager is often a being of intense chaos, wildness, or anger, so as to pass those attributes onto the barbarian. A Bloodrager can strike a bargain with the following otherworldly beings.

entries.name: The Ancient Wyrm
entries: Few beings are more primal than a dragon, and a great wyrm's fire burns in your heart, fueling your rage and magic alike.

entries.name: The Archfey
entries: A Feylord—a master of mischief—has chosen to grant you the secrets of their madness and trickery, reinforcing your wild impulses.

entries.name: The Fathomless
entries: An entity from the depths of the sea has beckoned to you. You constantly feel the deep waters calling to you, as well as a hatred for many surface denizens.

entries.name: The Fiend
entries: A corrupted being of the lower planes has promised you power and might beyond imagination. You have agreed, becoming a tool of pure carnage.

entries.name: The Great Old One
entries: The incomprehensibility of a mysterious entity has altered your mind, allowing your mindless rage to come all the easier.

entries.name: The Undying
entries: A being of undeath has made you the target of its possession. You are mostly in control of your actions, but your control wanes under the influence of your rage.

subclassFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: Starting when you choose this tradition at 3rd level, the magic of your blood is unleashed, and you begin to channel it.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: You learn two cantrips of your cohice from the warlock spell list. You learn an additional warlock cantrip of your choice at 10th level.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Path of the Bloodrager Spellcasting table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your warlock spells of 1st through 4th level. The table also shows what the level of those slots is; all of your spell slots are the same level. To cast one of your warlock spells of 1st level or higher, you must expend a spell slot. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a short or long rest.

For example, when you reach 5th level, you have two 2nd-level spell slots. To cast the 1st-level spell {@spell chaos bolt|XGE}, you must spend one of those slots, and you cast it as a 2nd-level spell.

entries.name: Spells Known of 1st-Level and Higher
entries: You know two 1st-level {@filter warlock spells|spells|subclass=barbarian: bloodrager (SCOE)} of your choice. You may also choose from your patron's pact spell list.

The Spells Known column of the Path of the Bloodrager Spellcasting table shows when you learn more warlock spells of your choice of 1st level and higher. A spell you choose must be of a level no higher than what's shown in the table's Slot Level column for your level. When you reach 14th level, for example, you learn a new warlock spell, which can be 1st, 2nd, or 3rd level.

Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can replace one of the warlock spells you know with another spell of your choice from the warlock spell list or your patron's pact spell list. The new spell must be of a level which you have spell slots.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Charisma is your spellcasting ability for your warlock spells, since the power of your magic comes from your will being unleashed on the world. You use your Charisma whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Charisma modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a warlock spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

subclassFeature.name: Intimidating Guise
entries: Also at 3rd level, your imposing presence gives you an edge in battle. While you aren't wearing any armor, your Armor Class is equal to 10 + your Constitution modifier + your Charisma modifier. You can use a shield and still gain this benefit.

subclassFeature.name: Blood Pact
entries: At 3rd level, you can feel the power of your patroow through your veins more intensely while you rage. When you rage, you gain one of the following benefits, depending on your chosen patron.

entries.name: The Ancient Wyrm
entries: When you enter a rage, choose one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder. You gain resistance to the chosen damage type for the duration of your rage, and you rage damage becomes the chosen damage type.

entries.name: The Archfey
entries: When you deal damage to a creature, it glows with a faint, ethereal light until you hit another creature or until the end of your next turn. For the duration, the creature can't become {@condition invisible}, and any creature can use its bonus action to gain a bonus to its next attack roll against the target equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum +1).

entries.name: The Fathomless
entries: When a creature you can see within 15 feet of you takes damage, you can use your reaction to summon a spectral tentacle to protect them from harm. In doing so, you reduce the damage the creature takes by an amount equal to your rage damage bonus.

entries.name: The Fiend
entries: When you use your Reckless Attack feature, your melee attacks deal additional fire damage equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum +1).

entries.name: The Great Old One
entries: When you score a critical hit against a creature, it becomes {@condition frightened} of you until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: The Undying
entries: When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. You can't use this feature again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Bloodrage
entries: At 6th level, you learn to utilize your budding magic and combine it with your unbridled fury. You gain the following benefits:

items: You may cast a spell while raging, though you still cannot concentrate on a spell while doing so.
Casting a damaging spell counts as an attack for the purpose of maintaining your Rage.
You can add your Rage Damage bonus to one damage roll of a spell you cast on your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Attunement
entries: By 10th level, your familiarity with magic has grown, developing beyond an instinctual reflex. You learn two {@filter ritual spells of your choice from the sorcerer, warlock, or wizard spell list|spells|level=1;2|class=sorcerer;warlock;wizard|components & miscellaneous=ritual} (the two spells needn't be from the same list). The spell must be 1st or 2nd level, and you can only cast these spells as rituals.
Additionally, while you rage, your melee weapon attacks count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

subclassFeature.name: Unleashed Potential
entries: At 14th level, your patron grants you the boon of casting an additional spell from the Unleashed Potential Spells table below. You can cast this spell once without expending a spell slot or material components, and you can't cast it again until you finish a long rest. If this spell requires concentration, you may concentrate on it while you rage.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Green
entries: Barbarians who follow the Path of the Green often live in quiet, self-contained tribes along coasts, forests, mountains, and beyond, finding better company amongst the quiet and beauty of nature's flora and fauna than with most "civilized" populations. When such pristine domains are threatened, the ire of such barbarians is roused, and they bring with them unbridled fury and wrath of nature's scorn. They speak—and fight—for the animals and the trees that cannot do so for themselves.

entries.caption: Personal Totems
rows: A piece of a geode that seems to give off a faint light, sparkling even when there is no light to reflect.
A tooth you pulled from an animal that was having dental trouble, who seemed grateful afterward.
An egg with an interesting red-scaled shell that has never hatched, but when held up to bright light feels warm and as if something is moving within.
A small cricket you keep in a tiny box that you consider to be a good luck charm.
A beautiful orchid that, though plucked, never seems to wilt.
A single {@item caltrop|PHB} made from large, intertwined that has only seemed to have gotten harded and sharper with time.

entries.caption: Superstitions
rows: It's wrong to step on a bug; they have families too.
You always tell the truth to animals—except bees. It's okay to lie to bees.
Eating anything that had a face runs the risk of being haunted by that creature's spirit.
If you begin your day thanking the trees for the air in your lungs and thanking the plants and animals for being your meals, the earthmother will bless you.
When you get lost in the forest, the winds will guide you wrong if you mar the trees.
Never trust someone that can't garden. If they can't nuture such a simple life, they'll have little regard for yours.

subclassFeature.name: Vine Lash
entries: Starting when you choose this path at 3rd level, your fury can summon a spectral, thorned vine that strikes at your foes. While you are raging, you can use your bonus action to cause a 10-foot-long vine to spring from the ground at a point within 60 feet of you that you can see. The vine lasts for 1 minute, or until you end this effect on your turn (no action required).

When you create this vine, you can make a melee spell attack against a creature within 10 feet of it. On a hit, the target takes piercing damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Rage damage bonus. As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the vine up to 20 feet and repeat the attack against a creature within 10 feet of it.
You can use this feature only once per rage.

subclassFeature.name: Wild Child
entries: At 6th level, you can feel the vibrant life of the flora and fauna around you. You have the ability to communicate with beasts and plants as if you shared a language, though it takes you four times longer to convey information to a beast or plant than it does to speak with another creature.
Additionally, while you are raging, you have advantage agaiinst spells and other magical effects that would reduce your speed or cause you to become {@condition paralyzed} or {@condition restrained}.

subclassFeature.name: Nature's Sentinel
entries: Starting at 10th level, you have attuned yourself closely with nature and are able to defend against its elements. You become immune to poison and disease.

Additionally, when you enter a rage, choose one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder. For the duration of your rage, you have resistance to the chosen damage type, and your Vine Lash feature deals an additional {@dice 1d6} damage of the chosen type.

subclassFeature.name: Call of the Earth
entries: By 14th level, natural life all around you shares in your fury. You gain the ability to cast the {@spell wrath of nature|XGE} spell without expending a spell slot or requiring concentration. If you are not in an area with natural trees, rocks, or grass, then you can conjure magical grass to spring forth in the spell's area.

For the duration of this spell, the size of the vine created by your Vine Lash feature increases to 30 feet, and when a creature you can see within 30 feet of the vine takes damage, you can use your reaction to reduce the damage the creature takes by an amount equal to {@dice 1d10} + your rage damage bonus.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you take a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: College of Dance
entries: Bards of the College of Dance feel the rhythm of music course through their being and cannot help but dance to the beat of magical energy around them. Weaving exotic and expressive movements, they try to bring joy and spectacle even to the fiercest situation. Most are found in travelling troupes or surrounded by adoring crowds, they do their best to dazzle all who see them.

subclassFeature.name: Rhythm of the Weave
entries: When you join the College of Dance at 3rd level, you learn to synchronize the flow of your movements to the flow of the Weave. You can expend 10 feet of your movement on your turn to use your body as a spellcasting focus and ignore the verbal component of your bard spells.

subclassFeature.name: Aggressive Choreography
entries: At 3rd level, while you are wearing no armor and not wielding a shield, you gain the following benefits:

items: Your AC equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Charisma modifier
You can take the {@action Disengage} action as a bonus action.

As an action, you can choose to strike a target within 5 feet of you with your body. If you do so, make a melee attack roll. On a hit, your attack deals bludgeoning damage equal to a roll of your Bardic Inspiration die + your Dexterity modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Striking Pose
entries: Also at 3rd level, you can perform a dazzling flourish, inspiring your allies and harming your enemies. As an action, you can expend one use of your Bardic Inspiration to perform a dazzling flourish. When you do so, choose one or more creatures up to your proficiency bonus within 10 feet of you that can see you. Choose one of the following for each creature:

items: The creature gains a Bardic Inspiration die, which expires at the start of your next turn.

The creature must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes psychic damage equal to a roll of your Bardic Inspiration die + your Charisma modifier, and is {@condition stunned} until the start of your next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and is not {@condition stunned}.

subclassFeature.name: Choose a Partner
entries: At 6th level, you can focus your attention on a single opponent, drawing them into battle. You learn the {@spell compelled duel} spell. It counts as a bard spell for you but doesn't count against the number of bard spells you know. You may cast {@spell compelled duel} once without expending a spell slot, and you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

Whenever you cast {@spell compelled duel}, you can use your bonus action to strike the target of the spell a second time with your Aggressive Choreography feature. You may only do so for the duration of the spell.

subclassFeature.name: Dancing on Air
entries: By 14th level, your movements become more fluid and elusive. You gain the following benefits:

items: You are resistant to fall damage.
Your walking speed increases by 10 feet.
When you jump, you can make an {@skill Acrobatics} check and extend your jump by a number of feet equal to the check's total. You can make this special check only once per turn.
When you use your Striking Pose feature, creatures have disadvantage on attack rolls made against you until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: College of Mime
entries: Bards of this college are actors and performers, focused upon empowering their spells with their own mischievous, deceptive skill. Members of this college are twisted harlequins: even the most powerful bards known to have studied it were said to use their creations for pranks, creating luxurious invisible charis before dismissing the effect and watching their compatriots fall about on the floor, or mimicking their allies' mishaps with an unsettling precision.

Members of this college focus on bedazzling and befuddling their foes with their powerful enchantments and charms. It's all smoke and mirrors, so the rumour goes: the devastating jinxes of the College of Mime are entirely manifest in their victims' imagination. Whether or not that rumor is true, their combative potency is more than real enough. They play foes like fools.

subclassFeature.name: Silent
entries: When you choose this college at 3rd level, you learn to show, not tell. When you cast a bard spell with a verbal component, you can replace that component with a somatic component instead. Additionally, a creature may benefit from your Bardic Inspiration if it can see you, even if it can't hear you.

subclassFeature.name: Copycat
entries: Beginning at 3rd level, you begin to excel at mimicry and costuming. You gain proficiency with the {@item Disguise Kit|PHB}, and you can spend 1 hour observing a creature. If you do so, you can perfectly imitate their physical mannerisms.

Additionally, when you see a creature make an ability check, you can use your reaction to memorize their movements. The next time you make an ability check using the same skill within the next hour, you can replace your total result with the creature's total.
Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Magical Hoodwink
entries: At 3rd level, your thespian skill lets you convince, con, charm, and confuse your foes with ease. As a reaction when you see a creature within 60 feet of you make a successful Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma saving throw, you can expend two uses of your Bardic Inspiration at once, rolling both dice. You deal psychic damage to the target equal to the highest number rolled, and you reduce the target's saving throw result by the lowest number rolled, potentially causing the attempt to fail.

subclassFeature.name: Mental Conjuration
entries: At 6th level, your performance has become so perfect that when you simply pretend to interact with an object, you can make it real.

By gesturing as if a certain object exists over the course of 1 minute, you can create a nonliving object of vegetable matter within 5 feet of you: food, rope, lumber, furniture, or similar. The created object must be no larger than a 5-foot cube, and the object must be of a form and material that you have seen before. An object created in this way is {@condition invisible} and vanishes after 1 hour or if you dismiss it as a bonus action.
You may use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain any expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Spell Ventriloquy
entries: Beginning at 14th level, whenever you cast a spell that doesn't have a range of self, you can choose a point within 30 feet of you. The spell's effects originate from that point, and its range is calculated accordingly.

Additionally, if the point you choose is occupied by a creature, you can make a {@skill Deception} check as part of casting the spell, contested by an observer's {@skill Perception} check. Each creature that saw the spell and failed the contest doesn't see you cast the spell, and sees that the spell's visible effects appear to originate directly from that creature.

subclassFeature.name: College of Worship
entries: A bard may devote themself to a deity, drawing on divine power. These bards belong to Colleges of Worship, which are as diverse and numerous as the various faiths themselves.

Some Colleges of Worship are inclusive, representing alliances between allied gods and their worshippers. Others are secretive, excluding all except the most dedicated of bards for their particular god. The college may be structured and hierarchical, with clearly defined duties and expectations. Or it may be chaotic, merely a loosely affiliated group of bards connected by their faith.
